main event: Two unidentified objects were observed on the ground near Loma Linda, California on December 8, 1957.
interesting points: The objects were described as being the size of a basketball, white in color, with small white dots appearing at the end of the object.
The objects were observed for 2-3 minutes before disappearing.
The report suggested the objects could have been a weather balloon or aircraft.
Ground radar was used to detect the objects.
The weather conditions were clear with good visibility at the time of the sighting.
sighted object: two white objects on the ground
photographs: no photographs were included in the report
